review: Hopefully the updates will make it better.  After a couple weeks of use, I am not as impressed as I thought I would be.  I have had an Apple TV for a couple years and have no issues wit it.  We decided to set up part of our house as a guest area with its own entertainment area and needed another device to stream TV.  After reading all the reviews and doing comparisons, I decided to go with the Amazon Fire TV.  A lot of this has to do with being an Amazon Prime subscriber and being able to get the full benefits.Some issues I have noticed.  The streaming stops and reloads frequently.  At first I thought it was just because I am watching NETFLIX through it and not Prime TV (I have both because content is different).  That wasn't the issue because it also reloads on Prime TV.  I am running both the Apple TV and Fire TV side by side and the Apple TV performs better.  Once this is fixed, I am sure I will be much happier.  Also, the Apple TV has features like looking up what current local movie theaters are playing and times.  This is a nice feature to have.The plus is that when it is streaming uninterrupted, it is great.
author: Amazon Customer
